title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

For Task A, the response must identify the clause in the Fourteenth Amendment that was used as the basis for the decision in both Brown v. Board of Education and Hernandez v. Texas.

For Task B1, the response must describe a relevant fact from the required case.

For Task B2, the response must explain how the facts of both cases led to a similar decision.

NOTE: Task B is worth 2 points. If the response accomplishes the task in B1, the response earns 1 point. If the response accomplishes the task in B2, the response will earn 2 points.

For Task C, the response must explain how an interest group could use the decision in Hernandez v. Texas to advance its agenda.

Points for Task A, Task B, and Task C are earned independently.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any one of the following tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes any TWO of Tasks A, B1, or C or just Task B2.
The response accomplishes Tasks A, B1, and C or Task B2 and A, or Task B2 and C.
The response accomplishes Tasks A, B2, and C.
